com.pytsoft.cachelock

Class LockSmith

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pytsoft.cachelock.LockSmith

  • public class LockSmith
extends Object
    The LockSmith class is the key distributed lock manager component in CacheLock project. It supports Redis (with Jedis lib) , Redis cluster (with Jedis lib), and Memcached (with spymemcached lib) by default.

    Other cache server and client libs can be easily supported by create your own custom client and lock classes , which extends abstract CacheClient and CacheLock with abstract methods implemented.

    Distributed lock can be easily acquired through this class, for example: 

         LockSmite locker = new LockSmith();
     Jedis jedis = jedisPool.getResource();
     CacheLock target = new RedisLock("lock_key", jedis);
     try {
         locker.lock(target);
     }
     finally {
         locker.unlock(target);
     }

    Please make sure that all acquired locks will be unlock after no longer needed. The suggested way is to put the unlock method call in the finally statement.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Ben PY Tarng
    See Also:
    CacheLock, CacheClient

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        public void lock(CacheLock lock)
          throws LockFailedException
        Acquire target distributed lock from central cache server with default timeout.

        This is a blocking call with default maximum waiting time, and it blocks while the specific target key (given in CacheLock) is already acquired by another locker and not returned yet.

        Parameters:
        lock - Lock target with all required information (such as key, cache server, ...) inside (check CacheLock)
        Throws:
        LockFailedException - If any of the following is true:
        • the target key is null or with invalid characters
        • the target key cannot be acquired within maximum waiting time
        • cache server is unachievable due to network issues
        • cache server is inaccessible due to permission issues
        See Also:
        CacheLock, Constants

      • lock

        public void lock(CacheLock lock,
                 long acquireTimeout)
          throws LockFailedException
        Acquire target distributed lock from central cache server.

        This is a blocking call with argument defined maximum waiting time, and it blocks while the specific target key (given in CacheLock) is already acquired by another locker and not returned yet.

        Parameters:
        lock - Lock target with all required information (such as key, cache server, ...) inside (check CacheLock)
        acquireTimeout - Maximum waiting time in milliseconds for lock acquisition process
        Throws:
        LockFailedException - If any of the following is true:
        • the target key is null or with invalid characters
        • the target key cannot be acquired within maximum waiting time
        • cache server is unachievable due to network issues
        • cache server is inaccessible due to permission issues
        See Also:
        CacheLock

      • unlock

        public void unlock(CacheLock lock)
            throws LockFailedException
        Return acquired target distributed lock back to central cache server.
        Parameters:
        lock - Returned lock.
        Throws:
        LockFailedException - If any of the following is true:
        • cache server is unachievable due to network issues
        • cache server is inaccessible due to permission issues
        See Also:
        CacheLock
